ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Systems Cell Biology provides an overview of all of the organ systems in the body, summaries the functions of those organ systems, and shows you the main cells (and cellular mechanisms) contributing to organ system function. I would highly recommend this class to another student, because it was the best class I have ever taken. It concisely and memorably gave me an understanding of every organ system

I would definitely recommend CBIO 604 - as I said above, particularly for someone that needs to brush up on their anatomy & physiology, or wants to learn more about how to look at histological sections.
Give you basic understanding of how cell biology is. Good for students who are lacking a good biological background.

I would describe this course as a course which summarized the workings and physiology of various organ systems similar to the introductory physiology course with a brief introduction to the histology of these systems. I would recommend this course only to a student that has not already taken this introductory physiology course or a similar survey like course.
Yes, it is a great course for understanding general physiological processes.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Improved my understanding of the physiological context of the human body.

I'm a neurscientists. Most of my studies focus on the nervous system. However, I believe that it is important to also consider other organ systems when trying to understand disease. Therefore, this course provided me with a concise and memorable understanding of all of the other organ systems. I will use this foundation for my dissertation/research and the rest of my life.
Help me with a better understanding of basic biology.
